review_title: Cool technology company doing interesting work every day.
years_at_company: Cool technology company doing interesting work every day.
pros:
Brand new office space
Family feel
Opportunity for growth
401k match with health care
Flexibility
cons: Healthcare for a family is expensive

pros: Passable health plan and 401k. Decent but odd office space.
cons: Zero training or interest in giving it. Understaffed and unwilling to hire the qualified numbers needed to operate effectively. No maintenance staff, so no matter your position scrub toilets or get a 20 minute scolding about it. Random firings with little or no explanations to remaining staff. High turnover. Reactionary and unstable business practices where sales are king regardless of ethics, stock, or staff to implement proposed contracts. Capricious management and owners that treat employees like indentured servants. And finally, "parties" with mandatory attendance.
advice_to_mgmt: Some consistency and compassion in management style would go far. Qualified staff numbers and retention needs to be increased to actually get enormous workload done on schedule.

pros:
- Beautiful new office space
 - Friendly, hard-working co-workers
 - Flexibility
 - Top of the line product
 - Opportunities to grow within the company

review_title: Growing Company with a Great Product and Staff
years_at_company: Growing Company with a Great Product and Staff
pros:
- Great products, all controllers manufactured in-house with rigorous QA
- Business model truly benefits the customer, tons of glowing customer testimonials
- Tremendous experience in the office and in the field, multiple employees with 10, 20, 30 years with the company
- No elitist mentality from management and ownership. Everyone is willing to pitch in and get his/her hands dirty
- Hard workers only, no bad apples
- Supportive teammates. If you have questions and want to learn, they will help you succeed
- Growth potential as an employee and as a company
- Very nice office with comfortable working conditions
cons:
- Formal training is inconsistent, you have to want to take the initiative yourself
- Small company, so you will wear a lot of hats
advice_to_mgmt: Continue to empower and encourage your employees to grow and take on new responsibilities. Be willing to look outside the box for good people that want to succeed.

review_title: Terrible. No training and you're jus expected to just know what's going on
years_at_company: Terrible. No training and you're jus expected to just know what's going on
pros: MOST of the employees are ok
cons: You will get fired for the most minimal thing

pros: Pay was good, hours were terrible.
cons: Pinch a penny contractor. Quality control is non existent. Poor graphics. Problematic system. Controllers fail often and for no reason. Critical building systems should steer clear of these controllers.
advice_to_mgmt: None. They do not deserve advice. Keep doing the horrible work your doing!! The customers will figure it out. PS, the CEO records all conversations that he has with customers and employees.

pros: You have to do everything yourself. That's a plus and a minus.
cons: Decision-making is questionable. Hours can be long. Finances are kept secret.

pros: Family atmosphere, creative team, aggressive outlook
cons: Compensation, high turnover rate, small capital company
